title: Dissolution Protocol
outcome: A dormant Dissolution Protocol triggers a citywide paper-based referendum, compelling residents to choose between restoring pre-BCI rule, rebuilding BCI, or empowering grassroots governance. Factions campaign desperately, public debate erupts, and the city's future is suddenly in the people's hands.

events.description: All citizens receive a printed referendum: choose between restoring the old pre-BCI system, rebuilding BCI with new rules, or establishing permanent grassroots governance.
Factions within the Council campaign door-to-door, holding rallies and debates to sway voters. Tensions spark between supporters and opponents of each path.
Grassroots leaders attempt to organize neighborhood forums, creating rival public gatherings to the Council campaigns and growing the movement for local self-rule.
The referendum period closes. Crowds gather at central squares awaiting the result. Rumors of sabotage and attempts to manipulate paper ballots sow distrust.
The outcome is announced: no single option wins a majority, leaving Stenograd in a precarious balance. Open discussions of coalition government and new civic alliances fill the city.
